content.description: Start on the same holds as "Mon" (jug/pocket under the overhang), but move right to a jug and then follow thin crimps to the top.
content.location: Left side of the boulder, under the overhang.

content.description: Start on or just below the large orange jug. Head up on thin holds to a balancy crux.
content.location: Near the center of the wall. Look for the large orange jug about 6' off the ground.

content.description: Start under the overhang in the jug/pocket. Make a few tough moves, staying left. Top out.
content.location: Left side of the boulder, under the overhang.

content.description: Start at the obvious sit with a left hand jug and right hand side pull. Climb way out left to a juggy arete, then straight up to deep ledges and mantle out.
content.protection: One pad below and one on the butt-bruising boulder behind you.
content.location: Furthest left, on the northeast corner.

climbs.name: The Ground
climbs.fa: Idk... Herm-Dawg? Seems too obvious to be an FA.

content.description: Traverse from the southwest corner to the northeast corner of the Roadside Boulder.
content.protection: Pads would be nice, but it's a two foot fall.
content.location: Start with both hands on the detached flake on the southwest corner of this boulder, then traverse under the lip to an early exit above the overhanging boulder problems. There is an obvious exit, where the lip drops to meet the lip above these other problems.

content.description: This is an obvious wrap around warmup with a long, fingery slab and a nice, juggy punch at the end. I imagine I'm not the first person to do it... and Columbus didn't discover America. *Plants flag.* Anyway, stay under the lip on the traverse for full value.
content.protection: Really just a pad against that northeast boulder, as you're moving dynamically to the lip and it's right on your ass.
content.location: It starts with both hands on the detached flake, roadside, and finishes on the northeast corner boulder problem, which is Lava.

content.description: Stand start on small hands and good feet. Head up to the top on thin holds.
content.location: Just to the right of the small overhang, on the face.
